com.arcrobotics.ftclib.drivebase

Class DifferentialDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arcrobotics.ftclib.drivebase.RobotDrive
      • com.arcrobotics.ftclib.drivebase.DifferentialDrive

  • public class DifferentialDrive
extends RobotDrive
    A differential drive is one that has two motors or motor groups on either side of the robot. Each side acts as a connected set. You can see MotorGroup for more details as to how that might work. There are two types of drive systems here. You can use tank and arcade.

    Arcade drive use a y-value input from the controller and a value from the turn stick. We know that when the turn stick is pushed left, the right side should move forward and the left side should move backwards. Therefore, since pushing the turn stick to the left returns a negative value, it should be added to the left speed and subtracted from the right speed.

    Tank drive uses a y-value input from the left and right sticks. The sticks control their respective side of the robot.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • DifferentialDrive

        public DifferentialDrive(Motor... myMotors)
        Construct a DifferentialDrive.

        To pass multiple motors per side, use a MotorGroup. If a motor needs to be inverted, do so before passing it in. By default, the right motor speed multiplier is -1.0.

        Parameters:
        myMotors - The Motor objects in the differential drive. Must be in the order of left, right.

      • DifferentialDrive

        public DifferentialDrive(boolean autoInvert,
                         Motor... myMotors)
        Construct a DifferentialDrive.

        To pass multiple motors per side, use a MotorGroup. If a motor needs to be inverted, do so before passing it in.

        Parameters:
        autoInvert - Whether or not to automatically invert right side
        myMotors - The Motor objects in the differential drive. Must be in the order of left, right.

    • Method Detail

      • isRightSideInverted

        public boolean isRightSideInverted()
        Checks if the right side motors are inverted.
        Returns:
        true if the multiplier for the right side is equal to -1.

      • setRightSideInverted

        public void setRightSideInverted(boolean isInverted)
        Sets the right side inversion factor to the specified boolean.
        Parameters:
        isInverted - If true, sets the right side multiplier to -1 or 1 if false.

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(double ySpeed,
                        double turnSpeed)
        Drives the robot using the arcade system.
        Parameters:
        ySpeed - The input value that determines the vertical speed of the robot.
        turnSpeed - The input value that determines the rotational speed of the robot.

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(double ySpeed,
                        double turnSpeed,
                        boolean squareInputs)
        Drives the robot using the arcade system.
        Parameters:
        ySpeed - The input value that determines the vertical speed of the robot.
        turnSpeed - The input value that determines the rotational speed of the robot.
        squareInputs - Square the value of the input to allow for finer control

      • tankDrive

        public void tankDrive(double leftSpeed,
                      double rightSpeed)
        Drive the robot using the tank system.
        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - The input value that determines the speed of the left side motors.
        rightSpeed - The input value that determines the speed of the right side motors.

      • tankDrive

        rightSpeed - The input value that determines the speed of the right side motors.
        squareInputs - Square the value of the input to allow for finer control
